items.sentence: Tom has been working a lot of hours recently.
Tom has been trying to find something to eat.
Tom doesn't take very good care of his tools.
Tom is sick, so he didn't come to work today.
Tom is rich, but he's not as rich as Mary is.
Tom is rich, but he isn't as rich as Mary is.
Tom is really scared about what might happen.
Tom is probably a pretty good French speaker.
Tom is wearing the same clothes as yesterday.
Tom is waiting to see what's going to happen.
You need some evidence to bolster your claim.
You aren't really planning on going, are you?
You aren't really going to buy that, are you?
You aren't living in Boston anymore, are you?
Just looking at the food made my mouth water.
Are you sure that you don't need to get home?
Tom isn't my first name. It's my middle name.
The moon shines because it reflects sunlight.
Nothing you say would make me change my mind.
Tom said he hopes Mary won't want to do that.
